page.title: 06ROMAN BATHS
page.content: The Roman Baths are incredibly complete in layout, and are almost the best Roman remains in Britain. This is probably why 926,811 people visited the Roman Baths in the period 1984-85. In the museum you can see some of the mosaics and remains of the Roman city that surrounded the Roman Baths, and things that had been thrown into the spring as offerings. The best of all the things shown, is the gilt- bronze head of the goddess Minerva.The recently excavated Roman Temple Precinct was found under the Pump Rooms. Many people, in Georgian times, bathed in the Roman spring and drank from it; even now people still do this because they think it's good for their health.
